body:
### Docs page(s)

https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-magic-numbers#:~:text=This%20rule%20is%20currently%20frozen%20and%20is%20not%20accepting%20changes. and others, see the full list of rules here: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/18694#issuecomment-2355493603

### What documentation issue do you want to solve?

`This rule is currently frozen and is not accepting changes.` For me, this means you won't accept any changes, even bug fixes or documentation changes. Only after reading https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/18439#issuecomment-2105500273, did I get the difference between frozen and deprecated rules.

### What do you think is the correct solution?

You could describe with more detail what frozen rules like `typescript-eslint` do: `This rule is feature frozen: it will no longer receive new features such as new options. It still will accept bug and documentation fixes for its existing area of features.`

See https://typescript-eslint.io/rules/member-ordering/#:~:text=This%20rule%20is%20feature%20frozen%3A%20it%20will%20no%20longer%20receive%20new%20features%20such%20as%20new%20options.%20It%20still%20will%20accept%20bug%20and%20documentation%20fixes%20for%20its%20existing%20area%20of%20features.
